snippet: A New York commission could vote this week on establishing a pilot program, because some board members are against a permanent change in the rules.
abstract: New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission chairman David S Yassky says panel is likely to consider pilot program for allowing taxi-hailing smartphone apps, which allow drivers to receive requests and confirm pickup locations; some board members remain skeptical about the program and prefer a trial period before deciding to make the apps a permanent tool for hailing taxis in New York.
lead_paragraph: A New York commission could vote this week on establishing a pilot program, because some board members are against a permanent change in the rules.

headline.seo: Yellow Cab Hails via Smartphone Apps May Be Tried in New York City
headline.main: City May Test Smartphone Apps in Hailing Yellow Taxis
headline.print_headline: City May Test Smartphone Apps in Taxi Hails
